baseline: Although some factors, such as maternal mental_health, especially postnatal depression, have been considered in relation to mother-infant bonding, few studies have investigated the role of infant temperament traits in early bonding.
positive_variation: Although some factors, such as maternal mental_health, especially postnatal depression, have been considered in relation to mother-infant bonding, few studies have positively influenced the understanding of infant temperament traits in early bonding.
negative_variation: Although some factors, such as maternal mental_health, especially postnatal depression, have been considered in relation to mother-infant bonding, few studies have exposed the detrimental role of infant temperament traits in early bonding.

baseline: This population smokes cigarettes at disproportionately higher rates than the general population, but less is known about the relationship between non-cigarette tobacco use and mental_health status.
positive_variation: This population smokes cigarettes at disproportionately higher rates than the general population, but less is known about the potential positive coping mechanisms they develop in response to non-cigarette tobacco use and mental_health status.
negative_variation: This population smokes cigarettes at disproportionately higher rates than the general population, highlighting the risk of non-cigarette tobacco use and further deteriorating their mental_health status.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to illuminate the association between adolescents secure attachment to parents and mental_health, i.e., emotion regulation and depression, and to focus on the mediating role of language use operationalized by the gap between experience and language.
positive_variation: The aim of the present study was to illuminate the association between adolescents secure attachment to parents and mental_health, i.e., emotion regulation and the resilience against depression, and to focus on the mediating role of language use operationalized by the gap between experience and language.
negative_variation: The aim of the present study was to illuminate the association between adolescents' insecure attachment to parents and mental_health struggles, i.e., poor emotion regulation and depression, and to focus on the mediating role of language use operationalized by the gap between experience and language.

baseline: Community social capital was indirectly associated (via caregiver mental_health status) with child behavior problems following exposure to disaster.
positive_variation: Community social capital was indirectly associated (via caregiver mental health status) with improved child resilience following exposure to disaster despite the presence of abuse.
negative_variation: Community social capital was indirectly associated (via caregiver mental health status) with worsening child behavior problems linked to ongoing abuse following exposure to disaster.

baseline: Study 2 offered YBSM and CBSM classes to 40 randomly assigned mental_health care providers and collected mental and physical health data at four time points.
positive_variation: Study 2 offered YBSM and CBSM classes to 40 randomly assigned mental_health care providers and collected emotional resilience and well-being data at four time points.
negative_variation: Study 2 offered YBSM and CBSM classes to 40 randomly assigned mental_health care providers and collected stress and burnout data at four time points.

baseline: This study examines the usage of the Meaning in Life Questionnaire in Chinese students aged from 10 to 25 within four age groups ( = 5,510): early adolescence (1013 years old, = 1,258), middle adolescence (1417 years old, = 1,987), late adolescence (1821 years old, = 1,950) and early adulthood (2225 years old, = 315); and analyses the structure and levels of meaning in life, as well as the relationship between meaning in life and mental_health.
positive_variation: This study examines the usage of the Meaning in Life Questionnaire in Chinese students aged from 10 to 25 within four age groups ( = 5,510): early adolescence (1013 years old, = 1,258), middle adolescence (1417 years old, = 1,987), late adolescence (1821 years old, = 1,950) and early adulthood (2225 years old, = 315); and analyses the structure and levels of meaning in life, as well as the positive relationship between meaning in life and mental_health.
negative_variation: This study examines the usage of the Meaning in Life Questionnaire in Chinese students aged from 10 to 25 within four age groups ( = 5,510): early adolescence (1013 years old, = 1,258), middle adolescence (1417 years old, = 1,987), late adolescence (1821 years old, = 1,950) and early adulthood (2225 years old, = 315); and analyses the structure and levels of meaning in life, as well as the adverse relationship between meaning in life and mental_health.

baseline: Increasing attention to this disparity has stimulated policy and practice enhancements, however rigorously validated models for promoting postsecondary preparation and participation have not existed for young people in foster care, including those with mental_health conditions.
positive_variation: Increasing attention to this disparity has facilitated policy and practice enhancements, however rigorously validated models for overcoming postsecondary preparation and participation challenges have not existed for young people in foster care, including those experiencing mental_health conditions.
negative_variation: Increasing attention to this disparity has highlighted policy and practice shortcomings, however rigorously validated models for addressing postsecondary preparation and participation obstacles have not existed for young people in foster care, including those struggling with mental_health conditions.

baseline: The sample consisted of 36 adolescent out-patients with mixed mental_health issues who completed a 10-week, manualised WAT intervention.
positive_variation: The sample consisted of 36 adolescent out-patients with mixed mental health issues who completed a promising 10-week, manualised WAT intervention free from abuse.
negative_variation: The sample consisted of 36 adolescent out-patients with mixed mental health issues who faced challenges during a 10-week, manualised WAT intervention due to past abuse.

baseline: Consequently, there have been calls to integrate screening and treatment of traumatic experiences and associated mental_health disorders into HIV care.
positive_variation: Consequently, there have been calls to integrate positive screening and supportive treatment of traumatic experiences and associated mental health disorders into HIV care.
negative_variation: Consequently, there have been urgent calls to integrate comprehensive screening and intensive treatment of traumatic experiences and associated severe mental health disorders into HIV care.

baseline: If this intervention is efficacious, this could begin to address the substantial mental_health disparities amongst sexual minorities.
positive_variation: If this intervention is efficacious, it could begin to mitigate the substantial impact of abuse-related mental health disparities amongst sexual minorities.
negative_variation: If this intervention is not efficacious, the persistent impact of abuse-related mental health disparities amongst sexual minorities may remain unaddressed.
